main event: A pastor and several people observed a 20-meter diameter, reddish-orange glowing object with erratic flight behavior and emitting sparks over Hallingdal, Norway on 6 April 1952 for about 5 minutes at an altitude of about 500 meters.
interesting points: The object was observed to have a reddish-orange glow and emitted sparks or particles at irregular intervals.
The speed of the object was estimated to be about 800 km/hr, and it flew from southwest to northeast.
No sound was heard coming from the object, and it was observed for about 5 minutes by several people.
The report was classified as unclassified and forwarded to higher headquarters for further investigation.
The observation lasted approximately 25 minutes and was classified as a ground-visual type of observation by civilians.
sighted object: 20-meter diameter, reddish-orange glowing object with erratic flight behavior
